programme.title: WW2 Treasure Hunters
programme.desc: At RAF King's Cliffe, Madness frontman Suggs and militaria expert Stephen Taylor tells the stories behind artefacts unearthed from former military sites across the UK.

programme.title: Auction Hunters
programme.desc: Allen Haff and Ton Jones head to Hollywood seeking stock for their ailing pawn shop business. However, they soon encounter fierce competition for some of the more sought after items.

programme.title: Auction Hunters
programme.desc: Allen and Ton visit Hollywood for some stock for their pawn shop business, and the guys decide to take Big Sis to her first auction.

programme.title: Storage Wars: Texas
programme.desc: While Kenny and Matt bicker over a tool-rich locker in DeSoto, Mary bags a purchase that sparks a trip to the oldest Italian restaurant in Texas.

programme.title: Storage Wars: Texas
programme.sub-title: Welcome to the World of the Sonny Monday
programme.desc: The buyers meet their match in Waxahachie's go-getting locals. Will such stiff competition prevent the team members managing to get their hands on any of the goodies?.

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: Mike and Frank bid for slot machines, old advertising and bears that have been stuffed and mounted.

programme.title: Highway Thru Hell
programme.desc: The risks involved in the job are evident when a friend of one of the driver's loses a leg in a towing accident. Meanwhile, tow man Jamie realises he has a rival on the highway.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: The pawnbrokers value a ribbon from Abraham Lincoln's 1860 election campaign, an old detonator and a pair of basketball shoes.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: The pawnbrokers are given an antique book documenting the first laws of Congress, a potentially valuable mandolin and a robot that was considered cutting edge in the 1980s.

programme.title: In Search Of
programme.desc: Zachary Quinto meets a series of people who claim to have moved through time, as he explores the scientific potential for time travel.

programme.title: In Search Of
programme.desc: Zachary Quinto explores the scientific causes of sinkholes and what they mean for the future of the planet.

programme.title: Forged in Fire
programme.desc: Four bladesmiths are tasked to craft a signature blade from a massive piece of lift cable. The final two competitors return home to re-create a sword wielded by some of history's fiercest soldiers - the Two-Handed Landsknecht Sword.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: After Seth rescinds his invasive search policies for his employees, the women to return to work. The leader soon wrestles with a new problem - profits are down, so he looks at creative ways to get new customers into the store.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: The staff receive complaints from customers that a staff member has been letting customers cut in line in exchange for a tip. They later find out that Anton, who works the pawn desk, is responsible.

programme.title: Storage Wars Canada
programme.desc: Roy brings along Bogart's sisters to try and throw him off at the auction. Meanwhile, Ursula is in a bad mood and the others try to take advantage.

programme.title: Storage Wars Canada
programme.desc: Ursula is in need of a change of luck with her shop suffering from poor sales, while Rick and Cindy argue about marriage.

programme.title: Storage Wars: Texas
programme.desc: Bubba faces a tough decision, and Matt Blevins enters into a battle of the sexes with female bidders in the small town of Pantego.

programme.title: Storage Wars: Texas
programme.desc: Kenny Stowe shows off his wealth during an auction in Dallas, and Bubba responds by challenging him to a bidding war.

programme.title: Storage Wars: Texas
programme.sub-title: Excuse Me, I Think You're Stupid
programme.desc: The competition gets fierce at an auction in Fort Worth, where Cowboy Matt and Kenny fight over an abandoned item of furniture.

programme.title: Storage Wars: Texas
programme.desc: Kenny acquires a locker full of martial arts equipment that puts him in a compromising position. Mary reveals the extent of her ambition and Jenny uses underhand tactics.

programme.title: Storage Wars: Texas
programme.desc: Bubba, Kenny and Matt compete fiercely over the bargains on offer at an auction in Forth Worth.

programme.title: Storage Wars: Texas
programme.desc: The bidders go to Waxahachie, where Jenny makes a scandalous discovery that could prove very profitable.

programme.title: Storage Wars: Texas
programme.desc: While Kenny and Matt bicker over a tool-rich locker in DeSoto, Mary bags a purchase that sparks a trip to the oldest Italian restaurant in Texas.

programme.title: Storage Wars: Texas
programme.sub-title: Welcome to the World of the Sonny Monday
programme.desc: The buyers meet their match in Waxahachie's go-getting locals. Will such stiff competition prevent the team members managing to get their hands on any of the goodies?.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: The pawnbrokers assess a collection of the first three years of Sports Illustrated magazine, a Second World War pilot's jacket and a half-size musket.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: The team receives a handwritten poem by Jimi Hendrix, a 1950s pedal car and a chessboard made for the Titanic.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: The pawnbrokers are given an antique book documenting the first laws of Congress, a potentially valuable mandolin and a robot that was considered cutting edge in the 1980s.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: The pawnbrokers value a ribbon from Abraham Lincoln's 1860 election campaign, an old detonator and a pair of basketball shoes.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: The pawn shop staff examine a 1960s Cadillac, a collection of baseball world series rings and two antique pistol lighters.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: The pawnbrokers examine a holy relic and a letter supposedly signed by Winston Churchill, but are sceptical about both items.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: The team comes across a priceless Stradivarius violin from 1763, and a set of life-size Star Wars figures.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: The team is presented with a fully functional antique arcade claw machine, and is offered a piece of fabric with a presidential past.

programme.title: Irish Pickers
programme.desc: Ian and Butzy are in the very west of Ireland. They visit Mulranny, go fishing at Clew Bay and stop off at Swinford, before discovering something fascinating in Charlestown.

programme.title: Paranormal: Caught on Camera
programme.desc: An Oregon man shoots some incredible Bigfoot footage, UFOs gather over Texas and an active poltergeist appears in Wales.

programme.title: The Lowe Files
programme.desc: Actor Rob Lowe and John Owen Lowe visit a haunted penitentiary, known for its history of executions. There, they meet an expert in the psychology of fear.

programme.title: Billion Dollar Wreck
programme.desc: During an attempt to recover gold from the the RMS Republic, a panicking diver has an accident that puts his life in danger and threatens to shut the mission down.

programme.title: Britain's War of Thrones: The Hundred Years War, with Dan Jones
programme.desc: Dan Jones, writer, historian and consultant on Knightfall, continues his exploration of the Hundred Years War, recalling the epic story of the rival dynasties that forged the history of medieval and early modern Europe.

programme.title: Judge Romesh
programme.desc: The comic holds court over real-life disputes, featuring an extra who is costing his friend acting work. Plus, rappers Harvey and Romeo argue over lyrics copyrights.

programme.title: Judge Romesh
programme.desc: The 'judge' is faced with mediating a dispute in his own family, while two Yorkshire wrestlers fight it out in court.

programme.title: Would I Lie to You?
programme.desc: Team captain David Mitchell is joined by newsreader Huw Edwards and comedienne Sarah Millican, while his counterpart Lee Mack welcomes actor Bradley Walsh and actress Josie Lawrence. Host Rob Brydon oversees proceedings as the contestants try to hoodwink their opponents with absurd facts and plausible lies about themselves on the comedy panel show.

programme.title: QI XL
programme.desc: Gyles Brandreth, Victoria Coren Mitchell and Jimmy Carr join series regular Alan Davies and host Sandi Toksvig to contemplate the theme of 'not nearly' in an extended edition of the comedy panel show. As usual, correctness and even intelligence go out of the window in this quiz, in which the questions are so difficult points are awarded for the answers its questionmaster finds most interesting.

programme.title: Red Dwarf
programme.desc: Rimmer gets hold of a Quantum skipper and skips his way across the multi-verse looking for a dimension where he is not such a giant loser. Sci-fi comedy, starring Craig Charles, Danny John-Jules, Chris Barrie and Robert Llewellyn.

programme.title: QI
programme.desc: Stephen Fry hosts a special edition that poses questions on all manner of inventions, including some that proved to be 'just the job'. Trying to come up with interesting answers are Top Gear presenter Jeremy Clarkson, comedian Jason Manford, broadcaster Sandi Toksvig and regular panellist Alan Davies.

programme.title: The Indestructibles
programme.desc: Athletes take on daring stunts, with often hilarious results! Inspired by the sport of wakeboarding, Tim and Gendle invent a life-sized game of stone skipping.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: The Hurting
programme.desc: Clip show featuring the voice of Jake Yapp, as home videos reveal the dumbest things attempted by adults, kids and even animals.

programme.title: The Hurting
programme.desc: Clip show featuring the voice of Jake Yapp, as home videos reveal the dumbest things attempted by adults, kids and even animals.

programme.title: Aussie Pickers
programme.desc: Series following Lucas Callaghan and Adam McDonald who earn a living by restoring forgotten relics to their former glory.

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: Frank falls ill, so Mike's brother Robbie takes his place on the latest expedition, which leads to a set of antique spurs that could be worth a fortune.

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: Mike and Robbie sort through a property full of rusty relics and attend a lumberjack contest.

programme.title: World's Most Dangerous Roads
programme.desc: Celebrities undertake some of the most perilous journeys in the world. Comedians Ed Byrne and Andy Parsons drive along Siberia's M56 Kolyma highway, known as the 'Road of Bones'. Along the way, they brave sub-zero temperatures, traverse icy routes, encounter deserted gulags and meet the locals who inhabit the frozen wilderness, but despite picking up practical tips for survival, the duo feel they are out of their depth.

programme.title: World's Most Dangerous Roads
programme.desc: Broadcasters Sue Perkins and Liza Tarbuck drive along the Ho Chi Minh Trail, a network of roads and paths in Southeast Asia that was littered with unexploded bombs following the Vietnam War. Their journey takes them through jungles and mountains to some of the least-explored corners of Laos and Vietnam, and proves to be a gruelling test of their bravery, motoring skills and senses of humour.

programme.title: World's Most Dangerous Roads
programme.desc: Hugh Dennis and David Baddiel travel along more than 1,200 miles of hazardous roads in Ethiopia on a journey to Aksum, the country's holiest place. However, they have to contend with more than fatigue and unreliable terrain to reach their destination, as they encounter drug-taking truck drivers, suffer a disastrous breakdown and start to run out of fuel at the worst possible time.

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Jeremy Clarkson, James May and Richard Hammond compete in a land race from Resolute, Canada, to the North Pole in their most ambitious challenge to date. Pitting horse power against dog power they travel 450 miles across mountainous land masses and jagged sea ice at temperatures as low as minus 65C.

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Presenters Jeremy Clarkson, Richard Hammond and James May are challenged to build a bridge over the River Kwai in Thailand. In order to do that, however, they have to drive across Burma, a country that has been largely closed to Westerners for more than 40 years, and must make the trip in three lorries, each bought sight unseen from the internet on a limited budget. What follows is an epic journey of beautiful scenery, regular adversity, ongoing malfunction and the constant bickering of the three men.

programme.title: Room 101
programme.desc: Frank Skinner returns with the light-hearted panel show in which three celebrities argue the case for having their pet hates banished for ever to the fictional room. In the opening show, the big names with an even bigger axe to grind are one-time Doctor Who and Broadchurch star David Tennant, veteran broadcaster Trevor McDonald, and actress, writer and comedian Aisling Bea. Sushi, flossing, pigeons, lateness and queuing are just some of the things that get this trio's backs up - but who will Frank decide has made the most persuasive argument?.

programme.title: Room 101
programme.desc: Comedian Noel Fielding, footballer-turned-presenter Ian Wright and actress Joanna Scanlan reveal their pet hates to Frank Skinner in the hope he will banish them to Room 101. Things that really get on the guests' nerves this week include spiders, stinky cheese, hangovers and bad toast etiquette.

programme.title: Room 101
programme.desc: Model Katie Price, comedian Greg Davies and Citizen Khan star Adil Ray tell Frank Skinner what really gets on their wick, in the hope he will banish their bugbears to the infamous room for ever. The celebrities' gripes include friends who give their dog specific instructions and talentless people on talent shows.

programme.title: Not Going Out
programme.desc: When Charlie's school gets a bad Ofsted rating, Lee and Lucy start looking around for alternative schools. Despite Frank's protests, Geoffrey and Wendy offer to pay to send Charlie to be privately educated, which presents Lee and Lucy with a moral dilemma.

programme.title: Not Going Out
programme.desc: Lee interrupts Lucy's favourite TV programme by plonking himself down next to her on the sofa, eating her chocolates and talking loudly all the way through the dialogue. But when he suddenly can't remember the name of the leading actor and his hypochondria tells him he is losing his memory, Lucy's evening is completely ruined.

programme.title: Not Going Out
programme.desc: Unable to convince Lucy that he did not smash a blue and white antique vase that belonged to her grandmother, Lee summons the family to a meeting to flush out the culprit.

programme.title: Red Dwarf
programme.desc: The posse meet three cat clerics who worship Lister. Lister vows to help them as they're being hunted by a feral cat leader who wants to wipe out cats who worship anyone but him. Ray Fearon joins the regular cast as the ruthless Rodon, leader of the feral cats, with Tom Bennett, Mandeep Dhillon and Lucy Pearman as the cat clerics.

programme.title: Abandoned Engineering
programme.desc: A village ruin that is now pitted and scarred, a ghostly fleet of ships, a bridge to nowhere hidden in a forest and strange metal structures in a wood.

programme.title: Impossible Engineering
programme.desc: A look at the Airbus A380, which as the largest passenger plane ever built can carry more than 850 people non-stop nearly half-way around the world. With the largest wingspan of any commercial aircraft and four specially developed mighty turbo jet engines, the A380 weighs 560 tonnes and getting it off the ground would not have been possible without the work of past innovators such as George Cayley and Frank Whittle. Key developments in aerospace engineering - from Richard Whitcombe's energy-efficient wing-tip designs to Nasa engineers' cutting-edge control system, Fly by Wire - helped bring the A380 to fruition.

programme.title: The World at War
programme.desc: Laurence Olivier narrates this documentary chronicling events leading up to the Japanese attack on Pearl Harbour on December 7, 1941, and the subsequent collapse of unprepared British forces before the advancing enemy in Singapore. Includes interviews with veterans from both sides.

programme.title: Medieval Murder Mysteries
programme.sub-title: Arthur of Brittany: The Boy Who Should Have Been King
programme.desc: Prince Arthur of Brittany, who was subjected to the injustice of his bad uncle, John Plantagenet, the usurper of his throne and crown of England.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Medieval Murder Mysteries
programme.sub-title: Amy Dudley: The Queen, Her Lover, and His Wife
programme.desc: The suspicious death of Elizabethan noblewoman Amy Dudley, the wife of Robert Dudley, the favourite and alleged lover of Queen Elizabeth I and the man the monarch is said to have wanted to marry - if only he had been available. Amy's body was found at the foot of the stairs at Cumnor Place, her home in Oxfordshire in 1560, and her death caused a scandal - with the finger of blame pointed firmly at Dudley.

programme.title: Medieval Murder Mysteries
programme.sub-title: The Princes in The Tower: Royal Blood
programme.desc: Examining the case of the princes in the tower, and questioning whether or not Richard III ordered their deaths.

programme.title: Nazi Murder Mysteries
programme.desc: The German police's attempts to catch a depraved and psychotic killer, who struck fear into women travelling on Berlin's S-Bahn train network during the Second World War.

programme.title: Train Truckers
programme.desc: Expert hauliers Eric Harrison and Chris Case move an iconic Deltic diesel, better known as The Royal Highland Fusilier, halfway across the country to the Telford Steam Fair.

programme.title: Bangers and Cash
programme.desc: A 1970s Bond Bug three-wheeler divides opinion among Mathewsons customers, while a retired engineer reluctantly auctions off his late father's treasured 60s Jaguar Mark 2.

programme.title: Bangers and Cash
programme.desc: Mathewsons agree to sell a vintage threshing machine and large collection of tractors, but extracting them from old barns on a Yorkshire farm proves a bigger job than anticipated.

programme.title: Bangers and Cash
programme.desc: A Cold War Soviet classic goes under the hammer. Built like a tank, the Moskovitch gets few admirers for style, but finds a loving home with a fan of Eastern Bloc classics.

programme.title: South Pacific
programme.desc: Documentary exploring the region's islands, which are home to a vast array of extraordinary wildlife. The programme reveals how remote human communities native to the area are surrounded by harsh terrain and subjected to extreme weather conditions. Benedict Cumberbatch narrates.

programme.title: South Pacific
programme.desc: A look at how the 20,000 islands in the region became colonised by humans and animals. For the Polynesians, the Pacific's first people, their journeys constituted a feat of navigational ingenuity, while animals often had to rely on violent forces of nature, such as cyclones and tsunamis, to reach the shores.

programme.title: South Pacific
programme.desc: An exploration of the marine wildlife of the region. Included are the epic journeys of sperm whales from one side of the ocean to the other in search of food and a mate, the thriving species that inhabit New Zealand's coast, and the tropical penguins and sea lions supported by the Galapagos Islands.

programme.title: South Pacific
programme.desc: Documentary exploring the region's islands, which are home to a vast array of extraordinary wildlife. The programme reveals how remote human communities native to the area are surrounded by harsh terrain and subjected to extreme weather conditions. Benedict Cumberbatch narrates.

programme.title: South Pacific
programme.desc: A look at how the 20,000 islands in the region became colonised by humans and animals. For the Polynesians, the Pacific's first people, their journeys constituted a feat of navigational ingenuity, while animals often had to rely on violent forces of nature, such as cyclones and tsunamis, to reach the shores.

programme.title: South Pacific
programme.desc: An exploration of the marine wildlife of the region. Included are the epic journeys of sperm whales from one side of the ocean to the other in search of food and a mate, the thriving species that inhabit New Zealand's coast, and the tropical penguins and sea lions supported by the Galapagos Islands.

programme.title: Guitar Heroes at the BBC
programme.desc: Archive performances from BBC music shows of the 1970s, including Top of the Pops and The Old Grey Whistle Test, featuring Alice Cooper, New York Dolls, Peter Green, Queen, Robin Trower, John Martyn, Whitesnake, Joan Jett and Black Sabbath.

programme.title: TOTP2
programme.desc: Mark Radcliffe narrates the first of three special editions of the archive music show focusing on 1960s hits, beginning with tracks by artists including the Foundations, Julie Driscoll, Sandie Shaw and Procol Harum.

programme.title: TOTP2
programme.desc: Another selection of performances from the archives, focusing on hits of the 1960s. Featured artists include Clodagh Rodgers, the Move, Tom Jones and the Bee Gees, plus more from Top of the Pops and other shows from the era. Narrated by Mark Radcliffe.

programme.title: Chris Tarrant: Extreme Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Chris attempts to cross the length of Cuba, the only island in the Caribbean to boast an extensive railway network, starting in Havana in the west. This proves to be a major challenge given the unreliability of the service and the old trains regularly used, but makes for a fascinating journey to Chris's ultimate goal, the American naval base at Guantanamo Bay. Along the way he soaks up the sights and sounds of Havana, retraces the footsteps of the country's national hero Che Guevara, and visits the ghost town of Camilo Cienfuegos - a relic from Cuba's colonial sugar plantation era.

programme.title: Chris Tarrant: Extreme Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Chris journeys a thousand miles across Japan, starting out in Nagasaki, where the story of eastern railways began 150 years ago with the help of an enterprising Brit. In Fukuoka, he visits one of the Bullet Train's giant repair centres and in Hiroshima, he unravels what happened to its streetcar network after the world's first atomic bomb devastated the city. Along the way, Chris also meets a superstar cat and a singing conductor, while also checking into a popular trainspotter hotel and riding a steam-powered mountain railway.

programme.title: Train Truckers
programme.desc: Heavy haulage experts Ian Bagladi and Jamie Turnbull need to move a classical but abandoned 63-year-old, 70-tonne locomotive, through the English countryside.

programme.title: Waking the Dead
programme.desc: Feature-length episode. When the body of salesman Chris Dearden is found in a disused tunnel, investigations reveal he had been reported missing by his wife Lucy in 1996. The ritualistic nature of the murder leads the team to suspect a group of middle-aged men who had been on a self-empowerment weekend. However, the victim's son refuses to believe the body is his father's.

programme.title: Rebus
programme.desc: The maverick detective finds his career on the line once more when an apparently watertight murder prosecution collapses because of his unconventional interrogation methods. Facing the wrath of the victim's family - not to mention his own colleagues - Rebus digs deeper, but finds himself caught up in a spate of gangland revenge killings. Nicholas Farrell guest stars, with Ken Stott and Claire Price.

programme.title: London's Burning
programme.desc: Nick gets hold of the wrong end of the stick, and Blue Watch play a football match against Borough Street. Meanwhile, the team have to rescue a naked man from a burning flat.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Doctor Finlay
programme.desc: The Highland GP has a run-in with an old friend and later investigates what appears to be an attack on a gay man, only to find himself caught up in a traumatic domestic violence case. David Rintoul, Ian Bannen and Annette Crosbie star.

programme.title: Doctor Finlay
programme.desc: Highland medic Dr Finlay begins to suspect the Reverend Gill may be more interested in the pleasures of this world than the rewards of the next, and sets out to investigate. Meanwhile, his colleague Dr Napier delivers glad tidings to a married woman - but does not receive the joyful response he anticipated. Rural drama, with David Rintoul and Jessica Turner.

programme.title: Lovejoy
programme.desc: A dawn raid by bailiffs leaves the antiques dealer staring ruin in the face, and with nothing left to look forward to, he decides to turn his back on society. With Ian McShane and guest star Alexei Sayle.

programme.title: Lovejoy
programme.desc: The dealer recruits con artists Matron Jackie, Gideon and Henry the Hearse Chaser to attend an auction where he is selling a painting, to purposely bid against each other to bump up the price. However, Lady Jane also bids and after discovering the ruse concocts a plan to get her own back and wipe the smile off Lovejoy's face. Charlotte Cornwell guest stars with Ian McShane and Phyllis Logan.

programme.title: Sharpe
programme.desc: Obadiah Hakeswill returns to create more mischief, kidnapping a beautiful aristocrat and undermining the discipline of Wellesley's men. Sharpe is dispatched to thwart his old foe, and manages to inflict a humiliating defeat on French forces in the process - but only at terrible personal loss to himself. Sean Bean, Elizabeth Hurley and Pete Postlethwaite star.

programme.title: Auf Wiedersehen, Pet
programme.desc: Ally's dodgy dealings take a turn for the worse, and Barry has difficulty controlling Hazel who seems to be suffering from an overdose of sun, sea and sangria - to say nothing of gambling fever. Acclaimed comedy drama, starring Bill Paterson, Timothy Spall and Melanie Hill.

programme.title: Auf Wiedersehen, Pet
programme.desc: Barry finally announces his long-awaited wedding to Hazel is definitely going ahead and Oz secretly embarks on a romance of his own. Needless to say, Ally is concocting another dodgy scheme in the background and, as he puts it into operation, the lads sail off over the horizon. Comedy drama, starring Jimmy Nail, Timothy Spall and Tim Healy.

programme.title: Rosemary & Thyme
programme.sub-title: The Memory of Water - Part One
programme.desc: Part one of two. The green-fingered amateur sleuths are drawn into another mystery when a barrister employing them to spruce up his garden discovers his cousin has been drowned, only for the man to be spotted alive and well a few days later. Felicity Kendal and Pam Ferris star.

programme.title: Rosemary & Thyme
programme.sub-title: The Memory of Water - Part Two
programme.desc: Part two of two. The amateur sleuths continue their investigation after Martin Frazer's cousin, who supposedly drowned, is spotted alive and well a few days later. Mystery drama, starring Felicity Kendal and Pam Ferris.

programme.title: Rosemary & Thyme
programme.desc: The duo are enlisted to design a memorial garden based on the myth of Orpheus and Eurydice, but someone begins vandalising their work on a nightly basis. Matters are complicated still further by the death of a recovering alcoholic, whose body is found at the site. Mystery drama, starring Felicity Kendal and Pam Ferris, with Phyllida Law, Joanna David and Daisy Dunlop.

programme.title: The Brokenwood Mysteries
programme.desc: The owner and curator of Brokenwood's Historic Village, Charity Highmore-Browne, dies after being struck by an arrow. Mike and his team delve into the realm of New Zealand's colonial past as they deal with suspects including a blacksmith, a missionary, the local postmaster and the victim's sister. Neill Rea stars.

programme.title: Murdoch Mysteries
programme.desc: When a man dies in a deliberately set fire, Murdoch's investigation into the aftermath reveals some shocking personal history.

programme.title: Ashes to Ashes
programme.desc: A charity fundraiser who has travelled the country in a bath of baked beans is shot in a robbery, but his obsessive compulsive disorder gets on Gene's nerves, causing the DCI to beat a confession out of anyone who gets in his way. After the Clown warns Alex someone is going to die, she worries about Hunt's strong-arm tactics - and fights to keep control of the case. Matthew Macfadyen guest stars.

programme.title: Ashes to Ashes
programme.desc: Alex realises there are just 24 hours until her parents die in a car bombing and chooses a horrified Ray to help her save them. Amid the chaos of a Gay Pride march, she arrests Tim and Caroline in the hope of keeping them safe, but with Lord Scarman due to visit the station a nervous Gene releases all the prisoners, aiming to make a good impression. Guest starring Geoffrey Palmer.

programme.title: Kavanagh QC
programme.desc: The parents of a teenage murder victim ask Kavanagh to pursue a private prosecution on their behalf and he promptly agrees, despite the fact they are unemployed and unable to pay a fee. The accused is related to a powerful local crook, and finding witnesses prepared to testify proves no easy task. John Thaw stars, with Lisa Harrow and Nicholas Jones.

programme.desc: A preview of the stories appearing in tomorrow's national newspapers.

programme.desc: Join Stephen Dixon and Gillian Joseph for all the news from home and abroad, the latest sport and weather, and a review of the weekend papers.

programme.title: Tenable
programme.desc: Quiz hosted by Warwick Davis in which five members of a running club answer questions about top 10 lists from the realms of pop culture and general knowledge, then try to score a perfect 10 in the final round to take home the prize money.

programme.title: ITV Nightscreen
programme.desc: Text-based information service.

programme.title: Who's Doing the Dishes?
programme.desc: TV singers and vocal coaches Carrie and David Grant are today's VIP cooks, providing the food for Team Uniform - comprising a policeman, a vicar, a fireman and a midwife - who have to guess their identities with the help of a few cryptic clues. If the guests are successful, they will be one step closer to winning the full cash prize - but if they fail, they will be the ones doing the washing up. Hosted by Brian McFadden.

programme.title: ITV Nightscreen
programme.desc: Text-based information service.

programme.title: Dino Dana
programme.desc: Dana and Grandma decide which one out of three dinosaurs would win in a fight, based on their size, strength, and various skills.

programme.title: Super 4
programme.desc: Animated comedy adventure series featuring a gang of heroes who protect the city of Technopolis and its King Kenric against evil elements.

programme.title: Super 4
programme.desc: Animated comedy adventure series featuring a gang of heroes who protect the city of Technopolis and its King Kenric against evil elements.

programme.title: Robozuna
programme.desc: After helping a new rebel group steal a shipment of Corvus weapons, Ariston is thrilled that the Freebot Fighters are inspiring others to join the revolution..

programme.title: Mission Employable
programme.desc: Agent Danny finds out what it takes to man the controls of a cross-country locomotive when he spends the day as a train driver.

programme.title: Mr Magoo
programme.desc: Fizz and Weasel are after the president's jokebook. But Magoo, thinking he's in his dojo, enters the high-security unit where it's kept....

programme.title: Mr Magoo
programme.desc: Magoo's going to miss his flight. Unfortunately, he's not at the airport, but the supermarket, where Fizz and Weasel are hatching their latest plan..

programme.title: Mr Magoo
programme.sub-title: The Prophecy of the Goldensand'S Dragon
programme.desc: Fizz is at the beach building a sandcastle. Magoo thinks they are preparing to thwart an attack by an enemy riding a dragon..

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series
programme.desc: Mrs. Wicket becomes inconsolable when Scrapper goes missing. Mr. Bean investigates..

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series
programme.desc: Mr. Bean has finished his model car collection, what next? What about football stickers?.

programme.title: Ben 10
programme.desc: During medieval times, Team Tennyson must fight to remember that they're not in the past at all, but actually at a Renaissance-esque faire.

programme.title: Robozuna
programme.desc: Children's sci-fi fantasy series about 14-year-old orphan Ariston and his robot Mangle, fighting an evil empire together.

programme.title: The Rubbish World of Dave Spud
programme.desc: Dave gets a girlfriend who turns out to be an alien. And she turns out to bear a striking similarity to an everyday household item..

programme.title: The Rubbish World of Dave Spud
programme.desc: Anna is practising for the school cycling test and is good at it. Dave isn't quite as skilled, but with a new bike from his parents he really hopes to pass..

programme.title: James Martin's Saturday Morning
programme.desc: James is joined by guests Roman Kemp and Vick Hope, and chefs Marcus Wareing and Jose Pizarro. Plus, Bettina Campolucci Bordi demonstrates some vegan recipes.

programme.title: James Martin's Islands to Highlands
programme.desc: The chef is joined by Paul Ainsworth to explore the culinary delights of Dorset, with the pair going aboard a millionaire's yacht, where James cooks a sea bass dish. Paul samples local cheeses, while James visits a breeder with Mangalitsa pigs in a beautiful coastline setting.

programme.title: Ainsley's Mediterranean Cookbook
programme.desc: Ainsley Harriott's tour of Sardinia continues in the Nuoro region, where his guide Claudio takes him to meet his parents, who run a small bakery specialising in pane carasau, a thin crispy bread found all over the island. Claudio then takes the chef to his family's citrus farm to discover local fruit the pompia, a citrus so bitter it is never eaten raw but makes a fabulous liqueur. Moving up to the hills, Ainsley cooks a traditional sheep stew with a group of shepherds, visits one of the island's ancient archaeological sites and cooks up a Sardinian-style minestrone.

programme.title: Love Your Garden
programme.desc: Alan Titchmarsh and the team heads to the Yorkshire Dales to surprise Jim Thompson, a terminally ill 65-year-old grandfather and fundraiser. Despite Jim's own diagnosis, his commitment to spreading awareness and raising money for prostate cancer charities are legendary in the area, including creating a 'Calendar Girls' style naked calendar. Inspired by his bravery and dedication, the makeover team decide to turn Jim's overgrown and dangerous plot into a classic cottage garden with a Yorkshire twist.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: A planning dispute leads to murder after a stalwart in the Midsomer Conservation Society suspects her neighbours are involved in a money-making development scam. Political wrangling, burglaries and sexual liaisons abound in picturesque Great Pelfe as Barnaby and Jones investigate. Guest starring Hugo Speer (Bleak House), with John Nettles, Jason Hughes and Jane Wymark.

programme.title: Tipping Point: Lucky Stars
programme.desc: Ben Shephard invites Ricky Wilson, Russell Kane and Chizzy Akudolu to take part in a special edition of the quiz show, in which contestants answer questions to win turns on an arcade-style machine. Dropping tokens down a choice of four chutes, they hope to knock piles of them off a moving shelf - and the more they collect, the better their chances of collecting the 20,000 prize for their selected charity.

programme.title: The Chase Celebrity Special
programme.desc: Bradley Walsh presents as celebrity contestants Sarah Willingham, Shaun Ryder, Michelle Dewberry and Eddie Edwards pit their wits against ruthless quiz genius the Chaser in the hope of winning a potential prize pot worth thousands of pounds. They must work as a team and play strategically to answer general knowledge questions against the clock and race down the game board to the exit without being caught.

programme.title: Ninja Warrior UK
programme.desc: Competitors from across the nation test their strength, speed and courage in this obstacle course challenge, including weatherman Alex Beresford and former British Rugby player Maggie Alphonsi. Hosted by Ben Shephard, Rochelle Humes and Chris Kamara. Those who make it to the end of the adrenaline-fuelled mission face one final task - scaling the heights of a tower named Mount Midoriyama - as they battle it out for the title of Ninja Warrior UK.

programme.title: In for a Penny
programme.desc: In this edition, Stephen Mulhern hosts the game show from Swansea, setting members of the public unusual challenges for a chance to win anything from the price of their petrol to 1,000 in the big finale game.

programme.title: Britain's Got Talent
programme.desc: Ant and Dec host the 14th series of nationwide talent search, which sees a wide variety of acts, from comedians to contortionists, singers to spoon players, compete for the chance to win 250,000 and a coveted slot at the Royal Variety Performance. Simon Cowell, Amanda Holden, Alesha Dixon and David Walliams are once again on hand to judge this week's applicants, and each of them has the chance to put their favourite contestant straight through to the live semi-finals by awarding them the Golden Buzzer.

programme.title: Through the Keyhole
programme.desc: American television presenter Jerry Springer, Strictly Come Dancing co-host Tess Daly and presenter of dating game show Take Me Out Paddy McGuinness make up this week's panel as Keith Lemon noses around the homes of mystery stars, rummaging through their most treasured possessions. With the help of the studio audience, the panellists use clues highlighted along each tour to work out which famous faces have agreed to hand over their house keys to the Celebrity Juice funnyman.

programme.title: Crank (2006)
programme.desc: An assassin faces a race against time when he learns a rival has poisoned him with a drug that will kill him if his heart rate drops below a certain level. As he sets out to take revenge on his enemies, he has to resort to increasingly desperate acts to keep his adrenaline pumping. Action thriller, with Jason Statham, Amy Smart and Jose Pablo Cantillo.

programme.title: How Do They Do It?
programme.sub-title: Design Airplane Parachutes/Create Solar Power/Make Photochromic Lenses
programme.desc: How explosive rockets are used to catch crashing planes in mid-air. Plus, why sunbathing techniques help scientists catch rays of sun, and the secrets of sunglasses.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Part one of two. Mike Brewer purchases a Toyota MR2 in need of Edd China's expertise, and the mechanic soon gets to work overhauling the car's bodywork.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Part two of two. Edd China continues working on the Toyota MR2, while Mike Brewer heads to a specialist company to get some refurbished wheels.

programme.title: Combat Dealers
programme.desc: Military equipment collector Bruce Crompton heads to a Cold War underground bunker that has been converted to a museum. The curator is looking for some Soviet era equipment to tell the other side of the story.

programme.title: American Chopper
programme.desc: While business is booming at OCC, Paul Jr struggles to find clients and considers building a bike without a commission. Meanwhile, Paul Sr reaches out to Mikey.

programme.title: Airplane Repo
programme.desc: A debtor swipes the helicopter that Ken and Danny were only seconds away from repossessing, Mike Kennedy seizes a charter jet, and Kevin is swarmed by the FBI.

programme.title: Dirty Jobs
programme.desc: Mike Rowe spins yarn from a sheep's fleece at a woollen mill in Ohio and has a go at body waxing at a day spa in Michigan.

programme.title: How It's Made
programme.desc: The long-running manufacturing documentary reveals how industrial casters, wedding cakes, tetrahertz spectrometers and racing catamarans are made.

programme.title: How It's Made
programme.sub-title: Ceramic Grills/Pneumatic Punchers/Water Jet Fountains/Wooden Surfboards
programme.desc: The manufacturing documentary reveals how ceramic grills, pneumatic punching machines, jet fountains and hollow wooden surfboards are made.

programme.title: Deadliest Catch
programme.desc: Part two of two. Rookie skippers Jake Anderson and Josh Harris struggle as a 600 mile wide arctic storm continues to ravage the fleet.

programme.title: Deadliest Catch
programme.desc: The fleet face a second major storm, while rookie skipper Jake Anderson reaches out to Sig Hansen for help and Josh Harris arrives on the grounds weeks late.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Part one of two. Mike Brewer purchases a Toyota MR2 in need of Edd China's expertise, and the mechanic soon gets to work overhauling the car's bodywork.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Part two of two. Edd China continues working on the Toyota MR2, while Mike Brewer heads to a specialist company to get some refurbished wheels.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Part one of two. Mike Brewer logs on to an online auction searching for a cheap Suzuki in need of repair. He soon finds an SJ410 and hands the vehicle over to mechanic Edd China for restoration.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Part two of two. The work on the Suzuki continues as Edd China gives it a new interior, paint job and roll cage, aiming to make a tidy profit.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Part one of two. Edd China gets to work transforming an old Mazda MX5, removing the leaking roof, rusty wings and seats.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Part two of two. The air filter, chassis brace and wheels of the Mazda MX5 are fixed, and the new roof is fitted before Mike Brewer takes the completed car for a test drive.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers: Trading Up
programme.desc: Mike Brewer tries to trade a little 'kei car' in Japan, but worries cultural differences might stop him from making a profit.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Mike Brewer plans to capitalise on 1980s nostalgia by restoring an original 1982 Toyota Supra, and Ant Anstead works to bring this 35-year-old car into the modern era.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Mike Brewer hopes to tap into 1990s nostalgia by working on an 1994 Mitsubishi 3000GT VR-4, but restoring the vehicle to its original state proves harder than expected.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Part one of two. Mike Brewer purchases a 1993 Lexus LS400 for little more than 1,000, hoping mechanic Edd China can work his magic and make them a profit.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Part two of two. Edd China finishes renovation work on the Lexus LS400 - respraying the bumper, adding new wheels, fitting clear bumper lenses and putting in carpets.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Mike tracks down a Lincoln Continental, which set new style standards for luxury sedans in the 1960s. However, tastes have changed, and Edd hatches a refurb plan.

programme.title: Swimming with Monsters with Steve Backshall
programme.desc: The naturalist travels to the Pantanal wetland area of Brazil to swim with and study the anacondas that inhabit the region - but his presence in the water could trigger an attack.

programme.title: Outback Opal Hunters
programme.desc: The Bushmen confront a miner who has illegally dug their claim. The Young Guns must find a new source of opal when poisonous fumes force them to abandon their mine.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Auto enthusiast Mike Brewer and mechanic Ant Anstead share their favourite moments from the series, revealing the hilarious outtakes, behind-the-scenes moments and private insights.

programme.title: Salvage Hunters: Classic Cars
programme.desc: Salvage aficionado Drew Pritchard teams up with Turbo Pickers' Paul Cowland for a motoring mission. They scour the UK, buying, restoring and selling classic cars.

programme.title: Salvage Hunters
programme.desc: Drew Pritchard embarks on a road trip, travelling to Norfolk, Pembroke and Essex. In Pembroke, he finds an old church that has been converted into an antiques store with a varied selection.

programme.title: The Repair Shop
programme.desc: The team takes on the restoration of a music box damaged during the Blitz, a threadbare toy lamb and a pair of fire tongs built by the owner's own great-grandfather.

programme.title: Robson Green's Australian Adventure
programme.desc: The actor's antipodean tour concludes in Queensland, where he goes 'off the grid' to find out what life is like away from the state's popular beaches.

programme.title: Outback Opal Hunters
programme.desc: The Bushmen confront a miner who has illegally dug their claim. The Young Guns must find a new source of opal when poisonous fumes force them to abandon their mine.

programme.title: Faking It: Tears of a Crime
programme.desc: The case of paralympian Oscar Pistorius, who shot his girlfriend Reeva Steenkamp dead in 2013. He claimed it was an accident, but there were suspicions he was falsifying evidence.

programme.title: Faking It: Tears of a Crime
programme.desc: The case of John Tanner, who took part in a police reconstruction when his fiancee vanished. Plus, Paul Dyson whose TV plea for his missing lover raised suspicions. Series examining the phenomenon of criminal cases where people publically feign innocence about a crime they have committed, shedding crocodile tears in the process..

programme.title: Faking It: Tears of a Crime
programme.desc: The murder of best-selling author Helen Bailey by her partner Ian Stewart, who had earlier helped volunteers in her search. The 51-year-old's body was eventually found dumped in a cesspit beneath the garage of her 1.5million home in Royston, Hertfordshire, alongside that of her dog in July 2016. She had been drugged and suffocated.

programme.title: Faking It: Tears of a Crime
programme.desc: The cases of Miles Evans and Fadi Nasri. Evans murdered his nine-year-old stepdaughter Zoe in 1997, but before her body was recovered he sat alongside her mother in an appeal for the public's help in finding her. In 2006, Nasri asked for help in finding the person behind a fatal knife attack on his wife Nisha, though in reality had hired two men to perform the killing to claim her life insurance.

programme.title: FBI Files
programme.desc: How a new DNA testing forensic procedure was introduced during the investigation into the disappearance of a Pennsylvanian woman and her infant son.

programme.title: Animal Cops Houston
programme.desc: Investigator Jennifer Francis intervenes when she spots two horses being dragged behind a vehicle on a busy motorway.

programme.title: Bondi Vet
programme.desc: Dr Chris Brown tries to help a West Highland terrier overcome his phobia of skateboards and visits the Australian Reptile Park to take swabs from an alligator and a python.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: Michelle expresses her interest in dresses by the salon's exclusive designer, Pnina Tornai. Meanwhile, a Greek woman looks for a bargain, and Audrey and Randy try to please Lillian.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: Bridesmaids
programme.desc: A maid of honour hijacks an appointment, leaving consultant Nicky to ensure the bride's voice is heard. Meanwhile, another bride tries to convince her sister to wear red.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: Bridesmaids
programme.desc: Lori steps in when a bride's sorority sisters gang up on her other friend. Plus, sisters who are both getting married fight over the same dress.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: Atlanta
programme.desc: Fashion director Monte comes to the rescue when a client lands in hot water, while 35-year-old Erin's mother reminds her she is not a young bride.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: Atlanta
programme.desc: Cancer survivor Joya's dream dress is beyond her budget, but her friends offer support. Ria knows exactly which gown she wants, but her picky entourage are not keen.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: Atlanta
programme.desc: Kari wants a conservative dress, but her mother is looking for something more revealing, while Nita's couture tastes do not fit with her mother's off-the-rack budget.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: Atlanta
programme.desc: Lori wonders if she needs to break out her sage to please superstitious brides.

programme.title: My 600lb Life
programme.desc: Holly already has a failed weight-loss surgery, so to succeed she must alter more than her eating habits. However, she must also overcome the childhood trauma that still haunts her.

programme.title: My 600lb Life
programme.desc: Chad undergoes gastric bypass surgery and quickly loses weight - but he risks his life by not following his doctor's instructions.

programme.title: My 600lb Life
programme.desc: A woman who married a man attracted to overweight women needed to undergo surgery, and now faces making a fresh start in her life.

programme.title: My 600lb Life
programme.desc: Documentary following eight people as they try to lose weight with the help of gastric bypass surgery. Zsalynn has become secluded in her home and has to rely on other people to take care of her. She wants to do what 'normal-sized' mothers can do and is at breaking point. Can the surgery help?.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: Crystal seeks a dress designed by Pnina Tornai, while Deborah feels a strong connection with Diana, Princess of Wales, and is determined to have her own royal wedding.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: Cynthia's veil clashes with her dress, causing mayhem, while Passant is running out of time with a limited selection of outfits.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: Second-time bride Becky hunts for a dress to make up for her disastrous first wedding, while Monica prepares to wed - four years after buying her gown.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: Tamara looks for a gown that makes a statement, while Stephanie arrives for her fitting, not yet convinced she has bought the right dress.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: The salon has a big sale - one of four a year - giving the brides an opportunity to snap up designer dresses at bargain prices.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: Tall Rebecca is on the hunt for a dress with the wow factor, but is afraid everything will come up too short, while Valerie is a small bride with big dress dreams.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: Stephanie wants to kick off Christmas with a Black Friday wedding, while Katie is hoping to look like an ice princess for her winter wonderland ceremony.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: The red carpet is rolled out in this edition of the show, and with a celebrity in the salon, there is no shortage of attitude.

programme.title: Long Island Medium
programme.desc: Theresa gives readings to top American sitcom celebrities, including Cheers star John Ratzenberger and I Dream Of Jeannie icon Barbara Eden.

programme.title: Long Island Medium
programme.desc: Theresa adjusts to life as she and Larry get closer to divorce. A sceptic turns when his dad is channelled. Plus, Theresa's mum makes her debut appearance.

programme.title: Hoarding: Buried Alive
programme.sub-title: Hoarding: Buried Alive: Where Are They Now?
programme.desc: The programme revisits extreme hoarders Randy, Laura and Chip to see how they have fared since appearing on the programme.

programme.title: Dr G: Medical Examiner
programme.desc: Medic Jan Garavaglia tries to solve the mystery surrounding the case of disabled woman who had a fatal seizure shortly after being released from hospital.

programme.title: Copycat Killers
programme.desc: Twisted fan Daniel Gonzalez, who tried to emulate movie horror villains Freddy Kruger and Jason Vorhees with a gruesome killing spree.

programme.title: Harvey Weinstein: ID Breaking Now
programme.desc: The crimes of former producer and convicted sex offender. Featuring a one-on-one with Ambra Gutierrez, the Italian model who wore a wire that captured audio that helped lead to Weinstein's conviction and sentencing.
